spacyr 0.9.91
  • Reference

Tokenize text using spaCy

Source: R/spacy_parse.R
process_document.Rd

Tokenize text using spaCy. The results of tokenization is stored as a Python object. To obtain the tokens results in R, use get_tokens(). http://spacy.io.

process_document(x, multithread, ...)

Arguments

x

input text functionalities including the tagging, named entity recognisiton, dependency analysis. This slows down spacy_parse() but speeds up the later parsing. If FALSE, tagging, entity recogitions, and dependendcy analysis when relevant functions are called.
multithread

logical;
...

arguments passed to specific methods

Value

result marker object

Examples

spacy_initialize()
#> spaCy is already initialized
#> NULL
# the result has to be "tag() is ready to run" to run the following
txt <- c(text1 = "This is the first sentence.\nHere is the second sentence.",
         text2 = "This is the second document.")
results <- spacy_parse(txt)
